results.title: The Life story of John Lee, or, The Man they could not hang
results.creator_credit: Arthur W Sterry, Frederich Haldane and Sterry and Haldane
results.brief_description: This story is about an Englishman, John Lee, who in 1885 escaped the gallows after being convicted of murder, because three times the trapdoor failed to work. After many years in prison a dying woman’s confession finally clears Lee of the murder. Although supposedly based on fact it seems likely that the silent film versions were based on a play performed in Australia in 1912. The success of the first film version (now lost) made in the same year led the distributors Haldane and Sherry to produce a new version in 1921 expanding the story to include scenes from Lee’s happy childhood. Piety and intensity of emotion are emphasised and the film is at times crudely sentimental. Despite negative reviews the remake was again very successful with the public. Raymond Longford remade the story as a talkie in 1934; this third version has also been lost. Cast includes Rose Rooney, David Edelsten Cinematography by Tasman G. Higgins. Silent film with intertitles.

results.title: The Passion of Joan of Arc = The Passion of Jeanne D'Arc
results.creator_credit: Carl Theodor Dreyer and Societe Generale Des Films
results.brief_description: The script was based on original transcripts of the trial of Jeanne d’Arc, period detail was carefully researched, unusually solid sets were constructed and a monumental performance given by Falconetti as Jeanne. However, it is the films formal rigour which places it in the forefront of experimental film art. Cast includes Renee Falconetti, Antonin Artaud, Michel Simon.

results.title: Hot lead and cold feet
results.creator_credit: Robert Butler, Ron Miller and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: A Walt Disney comedy about a pioneer who has founded the small town of Bloodshy. With the assistance of his twin sons, Eli discovers he must fight for control of the town’s future against the town’s corrupt mayor. With Jim Dale playing the three main roles this is essentially a family oriented adventure film set in the old Wild West, replete with gunslingers and outlaws. Cast also includes Karen Valentine, Don Knotts, Jack Elam and John Williams.

results.title: 102 dalmatians
results.creator_credit: Kevin Lima, Edward S. Feldman and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Dodie Smith, and a sequel to Disney’s 1996 live-action adaptation of their animated classic, ‘101 Dalmatians’, this live-action film once again features Glenn Close in the role of the over-the-top and rather bizarre Cruella De Vil. After three years in prison Cruella is determined to keep away from animal fur - especially of the doggy kind - but it seems despite all her best intentions, Cruella unwittingly finds herself again embroiled in a ‘haute couture’ situation. Cast includes Ioan Gruffudd, Alice Evans, Tim McInnerny, Ian Richardson, Gerard Depardieu.

constellations_other.name: Femme fatales to fembots
constellations_other.description: When women gain power, men get scared. You can see this in the mysterious, seductive and deadly femme fatale. Using her sexuality and intellect to manipulate, control and co-opt power, the femme fatale reflects prevailing attitudes to women.

results.title: Cool runnings
results.creator_credit: Jon Turteltaub, Dawn Steel and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: The world was shocked when Jamaica entered the Winter Olympics with a bobsled team. Although they don’t win gold, the four Jamaicans become heroes for their courage and determination to compete with the world’s best. John Candy plays the ex-Olympian, once accused of cheating, who acts as their coach. Based on a true story “Cool Runnings” repeats the ageless Disney film message about following your dreams.

results.title: Little Johnny Jones
results.creator_credit: Gary Halvorson, Bill Siegler, Showtime Entertainment and Group W Cable Productions
results.brief_description: This Goodspeed Opera House production of George M. Cohan’s classic American musical “Little Johnny Jones” is performed on stage in front of a live audience and features such hit songs as “Yankee Doodle Dandy” and “Give my regards to Broadway”. The cast includes Eric Weitz as Johnny Jones and Peter Van Norden as Anthony Anstey, with Lenny Wolpe, Ernie Sabella, Bruce Chew, Jack Bittner, Maureen Brennan, Anna Mcneely, Jane Galloway. Book, music and lyrics by George M. Cohan adapted by Alfred Uhry and stage direction by Gerald Gutierrez.

results.title: Las Patronas
results.brief_description: Las Patronas, Mexican women’s group giving food aid to migrants crossing the border
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

Las Patronas (The Bosses), a group of Mexican volunteers, have been passing food and water to South and Central American migrants heading to the US border on top of freight trains. This video has been widely shared and celebrated on social media, highlighting the compassion being shown to migrants on the US/Mexico border. Some viewers have questioned if its virality puts the work in danger, but Las Patronas shared the original video to raise awareness and fund their work. According to a 2014 article, the group was formed 19 years earlier, so they’ve been helping people for almost 30 years – far longer than social media has been around. The group was nominated for the Princess of Asturias Award in 2015, after a campaign from Change.org that collected more than 50,000 signatures in support. In a time when Central and South American migration is being used for political stunts in America - like Texas Governor Greg Abbot bussing migrants to Vice President Kamala Harris’ residence on Christmas Eve - Las Patronas depoliticise the media narrative and focus on humanity.

You can find out more about the group on their website (in Spanish) and follow them on Twitter.
description_for_label: Las Patronas (The Bosses), a group of Mexican volunteers, have been passing food and water to South and Central American migrants heading to the US border on top of freight trains. This video has been widely shared and celebrated on social media, highlighting the compassion being shown to migrants on the US/Mexico border. Some viewers have questioned if its virality puts the work in danger, but Las Patronas shared the original video to raise awareness and fund their work. According to a 2014 article, the group was formed 19 years earlier, so they’ve been helping people for almost 30 years – far longer than social media has been around.

This video has been shared widely with some viewers questioning if it’s virality puts the work in danger. However, Las Patronas have their own social media channels to raise awareness and funding for their work.

results.title: Emulation of Mugsy's Revenge for Commodore 64
results.brief_description:
As in the original Mugsy this strategy game is presented in a highly visual style with lots of detailed comic-book style stills and short animations. As a gangster in 1919, you see an opportunity to make money by illegally supplying alcohol during the Prohibition era in the US. Hints as to all decisions in the game are given through textual conversations with your assistants - these can include how much booze to produce, how big a bribe to give, and whether to invest in your own Speakeasy bar later on.

Unlike the original game, there are some arcade sequences which involve running around and shooting down the police as they try to arrest you. The character can be hit up to 5 times but it only takes one shot to take out a cop. After each of the game’s 10 years you receive a screen updating you on your progress, as well as a special one if you and your business survives the full decade. [Sourced from https://www.mobygames.com/game/16653/mugsys-revenge//]

results.title: Hyper >> [games magazine] Issue 100, February 2002
results.brief_description:
Hyper was a multi-platform Australian video game magazine. It was Australia’s longest running gaming magazine, published from 1993 to 2019.

In addition to coverage of current major video game systems and game releases, Hyper also covered anime, DVD movies, arcade and classic games, and featured interviews with industry professionals and articles on game-related content such as game classifications, computer hardware and video game music. Hyper also had a sister magazine, the PC gaming oriented PC PowerPlay. (citation from Wikipedia).

A digital version of the magazine can be found here: https://archive.org/details/hyper-100
